(585) 275-URMD (8763) Toll Free (844) 500-8763 An exclusive number for doctors and their staff, giving them easy access to the UR Medicine services they need most: SPECIALIST REFERRALS Set up an appointment with any UR Medicine specialist. URGENT REFERRALS Connect with the UR Medicine Transfer Center to facilitate urgent referrals. PATIENT INFORMATION TRANSFER Get instructions for transferring critical patient information to the UR Medicine care team. PATIENT STATUS UPDATES Connect with your patient's attending physician for updates on procedures or outcomes. CARE COORDINATION Get information on post-discharge care and relevant support services for your patients. GENERAL QUESTIONS Get answers to any questions you have about UR Medicine. CONSULT SERVICES Get advice from UR Medicine specialists 24/7 or facilitate transfer of your patients when needed. For your convenience, our Access Guide is available on line - simply visit Physicians.URMC.edu for an electronic version. Thompson Hospital ** Part of Strong Memorial HospitalSPORTS MEDICINE UR Medicine Department of Orthopaedics & Physical Performance 7670 Omnitech Place, Victor, NY 14564 (585) 275-5321 (585) South Main Street, Canandaigua, NY 1442453REV. 4/23(585) 275-3200ePartner Can my patients see the same lab and imaging results? Patients have access to chart information through MyChart. This includes lab, imaging results, notes, problems, medications, allergies and immunizations. Be aware that test results may be available to patients via MyChart before you have an opportunity to review and discuss them with your patient. Can I print information from the patient's chart? Yes. Are there special computer requirements? There are minimal requirements. Because ePartner is web-based, very little computer setup is necessary. In fact, ePartner is viewable on most PCs. You will simply need to be on the URMC secure network to login to ePartner, which is easily accessible through http://remote. urmc.edu. Accessing ePartner requires the following: Any Internet browser and network connection Any operating system (PC or Mac) Citrix installation For information about ePartner, please visit www.ePartner.URMC.edu.Does everyone get the same version of ePartner? No. We'll work with each practice to understand what best suits how you and your staff interact with UR Medicine facilities, and then match your needs with a version configured to ensure that patients' information is protected and secure. If you refer patients and order labs through UR Medicine, we'll recommend Chart View access. Or, if your interaction is solely limited to labs, we'll provide you with a streamlined view so you can quickly and easily access lab results. Can I update information displayed in ePartner? No, because ePartner is a view-only version of eRecord. You cannot add to a patient chart, or make any notation in the system using ePartner. However, if you are aware that specific patient information should be updated (for example, a patient's PCP), please contact the ISD help desk at (585) 275-3200 to request the change. Will all my patients be in ePartner? Any patient who has been seen at a UR Medicine facility is included in ePartner. These locations include Strong Memorial Hospital, Highland Hospital, F .F . Thompson Hospital, Jones Memorial Hospital, Noyes Health, St. James Hospital, Highlands at Brighton, Highland Living Center, lab draw stations, imaging locations, etc. Your access will be limited to patients with whom you are linked (by ordering a test, being identified as the patient's PCP , admitting the patient, etc.). If you are not formally linked to a specific patient in our system, please use "Request a Patient"in the inbasket to request access to that patient's record.UR Medicine's Electronic Health Record system is called eRecord. Community providers who work with UR Medicine may be eligible for ePartner access, a view-only portal into eRecord. ePartner enables community partners who refer patients (and their staff members) to view lab or radiology results, among other activities. WHAT TO EXPECT WITH ePARTNER ePartner is a secure, web-based portal that allows community physicians and their nursing staff to view real-time information about their patients' hospital stays, as well as access patients' lab tests and imaging results before a discharge summary has been completed. ePartner can be viewed on both PCs and Macs. WHAT'S INVOLVED IN USING ePARTNER? We've made access to ePartner streamlined for our community physicians and their office staff, while ensuring the security and appropriate use of medical records for our patients. To gain access to this system, please contact our Help Desk at (585) 275-3200 and ask for a ticket to be placed with our Regional Support team. The Regional Liaison will work with each practice to identify the physicians, nurses and staff who need access. You also will need to sign documentation that indemnifies URMC for the use of the system. Once these steps are completed, you'll be ready to go. It takes a couple of weeks to complete the important security and administrative work necessary for each user to have access, including some online training and release of a username and password. At this point, you can sign into our secure network, accessible through http://remote.urmc.edu.
